content.text:
<thinking>
Analysing the provided user research data to identify patterns and create representative personas.

Key observations:
1. Developer participants prioritise efficiency and automation
2. Designers focus on visual feedback and collaboration
3. Product managers struggle with information synthesis

I'll create personas that capture these distinct user segments.
</thinking>

<output>
{
  "personas": [
    {
      "id": "persona-001",
      "name": "Maya Rodriguez",
      "demographics": {
        "age_range": "30-39",
        "occupation": "Product Manager",
        "experience_level": "Senior",
        "location": "Remote-first company"
      },
      "goals": [
        "Efficiently synthesise user feedback from multiple sources",
        "Communicate research findings to stakeholders clearly",
        "Make data-driven product decisions quickly"
      ],
      "pain_points": [
        "Information scattered across too many channels",
        "Time-consuming manual synthesis of research",
        "Difficulty translating insights into actionable items"
      ],
      "behaviours": [
        "Reviews user feedback daily across multiple platforms",
        "Creates synthesis documents for stakeholder meetings",
        "Advocates for user needs in product discussions"
      ],
      "quotes": [
        "I spend more time organising feedback than acting on it.",
        "Stakeholders need the story, not just the data."
      ]
    }
  ]
}
</output>
